actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources

official_title: A bill to provide an 18-month moratorium on employer revisions upon termination of single-employer defined benefit pension plans.

summary.text: Provides for an 18-month moratorium on employer reversions upon termination of single-employer defined benefit pension plans under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. Requires that any pension plan surplus at the time of such a termination be: (1) paid to the employees; (2) placed in a new plan with higher benefits; or (3) placed in a trust for the exclusive benefit of the employees. Makes such trust continue to the end of the moratorium. Provides that distribution of plan assets would occur in accordance with applicable law then.

titles.title: A bill to provide an 18-month moratorium on employer revisions upon termination of single-employer defined benefit pension plans.
